channel.title: Username & passwords
channel.description:
here is my q for you... this is my code...
[code=io] @SuppressWarnings("deprecation") public void Append() { Write.format ("[USERNAME]" + UserName.getText().toLowerCase() +"\n"+ "[PASSWORD]" + PassWord.getText()); Write.close(); }[/code]
this method is supposed to write
"[USERNAME]THEREUSERNAME" "[PASSWORD]THEREPASSWORD"
but for some reason its like Java is ignoring the "\n" because its printing it like
"[USERNAME]THEREUSERNAME[PASSWORD]THEREPASSWORD"
This isn't for rsps this is a game ive been working on when im bored, and the method works fine except for this, its probably something obvious but idk it so i need some help.

item.title: Username & passwords
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Mr. Bobby, post:6, topic:373754”]system.out.println wouldn’t be useful since I’m writing a string into a text file when they enter there user name and password and press enter on the main menu.[/quote]Ah, I see. Then just use a buffered writer and use write line…?

Read full topic

item.title: Username & passwords
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Bobby Mr. Bobby
item.description:
@Mr_Bobby wrote:

here is my q for you… this is my code…

@SuppressWarnings("deprecation") public void Append() { Write.format ("[USERNAME]" + UserName.getText().toLowerCase() +"\n"+ "[PASSWORD]" + PassWord.getText()); Write.close(); }

this method is supposed to write

“[USERNAME]THEREUSERNAME”
“[PASSWORD]THEREPASSWORD”

but for some reason its like Java is ignoring the “\n” because its printing it like

“[USERNAME]THEREUSERNAME[PASSWORD]THEREPASSWORD”

This isn’t for rsps this is a game ive been working on when im bored, and the method works fine except for this, its probably something obvious but idk it so i need some help.

Read full topic
